criteria: Understanding of the underlying causes of World War I, including militarism, alliances, imperialism, and nationalism.
Knowledge of the major events and turning points of the war.
Analysis of the impact of the war on different nations and groups.
descriptions: The student demonstrates no understanding of the causes of World War I.
The student identifies one cause of World War I but cannot explain its significance.
The student identifies and explains two causes of World War I with limited detail.
The student identifies and explains three causes of World War I with some supporting details.
The student comprehensively explains four causes of World War I, providing relevant details and demonstrating a strong understanding of their interconnectedness.
The student provides an insightful and nuanced analysis of the causes of World War I, exploring the complex interplay of factors and offering original insights.
The student demonstrates no knowledge of the major events of World War I.
The student identifies one major event but cannot explain its significance.
The student identifies two major events with limited accuracy and detail.
The student describes three major events, providing some accurate details and demonstrating basic understanding of their impact.
The student accurately describes four major events, providing relevant details and demonstrating a clear understanding of their significance as turning points in the war.
The student provides a sophisticated analysis of key events, demonstrating an understanding of their long-term consequences and connections to broader historical themes.
The student demonstrates no understanding of the impact of World War I.
The student mentions one group affected by the war, but offers no analysis.
The student identifies two groups impacted, but provides only superficial analysis.
The student describes the impact on three different nations or groups with some supporting evidence.
The student analyzes the impact of the war on at least four different nations or groups, providing relevant evidence and demonstrating a clear understanding of diverse perspectives.
The student offers a nuanced and insightful comparative analysis of the war's impact on various nations and groups, considering social, political, and economic dimensions.
